gco:CharacterString.#text: Research Scientist, Watershed Hydrology and Ecology Research Division

gmd:LocalisedCharacterString.#text: Chercheur scientifique, Division de la recherche hydrologique et écologique sur les bassins hydrologiques

gco:CharacterString.#text:
The surface water quality (WQ) program, as part of the Joint Canada/Alberta Implementation Plan, is designed to improve the ability to detect change and predict effects in relation to point and non?point sources. A mass?balance approach has been used for assessing the quantity, movement, and cycling of materials in the watershed. Applying this approach required a sampling program which included quantification of the sources, transport, flux, and fate of materials and contaminants. The Surface WQ monitoring sampling includes, in part, collection of;
- event (freshet and rain) based WQ samples in tributaries ranging from daily to bi-weekly,
- WQ samples in the Athabasca River using cross-channel transect methods at specified Phase 1 sites, 
- enhanced (additional parameters) WQ  sampling at M9, M12, and M11A and at 5 new interconnecting channel stations within the Expanded Geographical Area (EGA),
- ground water samples in specific high priority tributaries, and
- auto-monitoring (near real-time) on a subset of parameters at sites in the EGA

water quality, long term monitoring, oil sands, Athabasca River, metals, major ions, nutrients, organics, physical and chemical, polycyclic aromatic compounds, mercury, naphthenic acids, watershed, contaminants, point source, non-point source, freshet, rain, under ice Peace-Athabasca Delta, Peace River, Slave River, concentrations, mainstem, tributary, expanded geographic area, passive sampling, event-based sampling, groundwater, contaminant source attribution

gmd:LocalisedCharacterString.#text: qualité de l'eau, surveillance à long terme, sables bitumineux, la rivière Athabasca, les métaux, les ions majeurs, les éléments nutritifs, organiques, physique et chimique, les composés aromatiques polycycliques, mercure, acides naphténiques, du bassin hydrographique, contaminants, source ponctuelle, sources diffuses, crue nivale, pluie, sous glace, delta des rivières de la Paix et Athabasca, la rivière Paix, la rivière Esclaves, concentrations, tronçon principal, affluent, la région géographique élargie, échantillonnage passif, échantillonnage en fonction des événements, l'eau souterraine, l'identification des sources de contaminants

gco:CharacterString.#text: This data set includes historic data from the longterm monitoring program funded jointly by Parks Canada, Environment Canada and NWT. An interpretative report of water quality status and trends between 1989-2006 (Glozier etl al., 2009) is available from  nancy.glozier@canada.ca

gmd:LocalisedCharacterString.#text: Cet ensemble de données comprend des données historiques issues du programme de surveillance à long terme, financé conjointement par Parcs Canada, Environnement Canada et les Territoires du Nord-Ouest. Un rapport d'interprétation de l'état et des tendances de la qualité de l'eau entre 1989 et 2006 (Glozier et al., 2009) peut être obtenu en communiquant avec Nancy Glozier à l'adresse suivante : nancy.glozier@canada.ca.
